[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: read_config_file()] [Path Injection] Does the unwrap() call on to_str() at line 33 allow attackers to cause validator crashes by providing paths with non-UTF8 characters, leading to loss of liveness? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: write_file()] [Directory Traversal] Does File::create() at line 44 create parent directories if they don't exist, and can this be exploited to create malicious directory structures or overwrite existing directories? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: load_config()] [TOCTOU Race] Is there a time-of-check-time-of-use race between read_config_file() at line 16 and parse_serialized_config() at line 19 where an attacker can modify the file contents, causing validators to load tampered configs? [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: write_file()] [Non-Atomic Write] Does write_all() at line 46 guarantee atomic writes, or can crashes during write operations leave partially written SafetyRulesConfig files that cause validators to fail on restart? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: save_config()] [Concurrent Overwrite] Can multiple validator processes simultaneously call save_config() on the same SafetyRulesConfig file without locking, causing last-writer-wins corruption of critical consensus safety data? [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: load_config()] [Read-While-Write] Can load_config() read a SafetyRulesConfig file while another process is writing it, resulting in validators loading incomplete or corrupted safety rules that violate consensus invariants? [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: write_file()] [Missing Fsync] Does write_file() call fsync() after write_all() to ensure data is persisted to disk, or can power failures cause loss of recently saved SafetyRulesConfig data leading to safety rule violations? [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: write_file()] [No Temp File Pattern] Does write_file() use a temporary file with atomic rename pattern, or does it write directly to the target allowing crashes mid-write to corrupt critical NodeConfig/SafetyRulesConfig files? [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/persistable_config.rs] [Function: load_config()] [No Integrity Check] Does load_config() verify file integrity before parsing, or can an attacker modify SafetyRulesConfig files on disk to manipulate validator consensus behavior without detection? (Critical)
